embed.title: üìú Embed Command Help
embed.description: This command allows you to create and manage embeds in your messages.

fields.name: !embed create
fields.value:
Creates a new embed.
Format: `!embed <title>/<description>/<color>/<footer>/<field_name|field_value|inline/stack>/...`

fields.name: Examoke
fields.value: `!embed Rules/Here are the rules:/red/Rules/Rule 1: Respect|Always respect|stack/Rule 2: Common sense|Always use common sense|stack`

fields.name: !embed edit
fields.value: Edits an existing embed.

fields.name: !embed delete
fields.value: Deletes an embed.

logging.title: üìú Logging Command Help
logging.description: Manage logging settings and view logs.

fields.name: !logging enable
fields.value: Enables logging.

fields.name: !logging disable
fields.value: Disables logging.

fields.name: Usage
fields.value: You can run `!logging #channel` to enable logging in a certain channel.

mute.title: üìú Mute Command Help
mute.description: Mute or unmute users in the server.

fields.name: !mute <user> [duration]
fields.value:
Mutes the specified user.
Provide a user to mute and optionally a duration (e.g., 10m for 10 minutes, 2h for 2 hours). Default is 1 hour.

fields.name: !unmute <user>
fields.value: Unmutes the specified user.

fields.name: !trigger add <trigger>/<response>
fields.value: When providing `hello` as the trigger, and `Hello there!` as response, the bot will reply with `Hello there!` everytime a message contains `hello`.

fields.name: !trigger remove <trigger>
fields.value: Remove a trigger. Requires the specific trigger. No typos.

fields.name: !triggers
fields.value: View the full list of all triggers.

leaderboard.title: üèÜ Leaderboard Command Help
leaderboard.description: View the leaderboard showing message counts.

fields.name: !leaderboard <args>
fields.value: Displays the leaderboard for the specified type. Available types are: `balance`, `xp`, `commands`, `messages`.

lb.title: üèÜ Leaderboard Command Help
lb.description: View the leaderboard showing message counts.

fields.name: !leaderboard <args>
fields.value: Displays the leaderboard for the specified type. Available types are: `balance`, `xp`, `commands`, `messages`.

sticky.title: üìú Sticky Command Help
sticky.description: Add or remove a sticky message.

fields.name: !sticky <message>
fields.value: Stick a message to the channel. The stickied message will always appear as the latest message.

fields.name: !removesticky
fields.value: Remove all sticky messages from the channel.

bounce.title: üìú Bounce Command Help
bounce.description: Bounce an image around the screen.

fields.name: !bounce
fields.value: Bounce an image around the screen like a DVD player.

fields.name: Accepted files
fields.value: Currently only JPGs and PNGs are supported for the command.

fields.name: !enhance
fields.value: Enhance an image using AI. Rate limited. Check the [official Discord](<https://discord.gg/c26ZCC3TKu>).

fields.name: Accepted files
fields.value: Currently only JPGs and PNGs are supported for the command.

fields.name: `!rank`
fields.value: View your or someone elses rank/level. Usage: `!rank [userID/mention]`.

fields.name: Setting Levels
fields.value: Server moderators can set the level of someone, and also give role rewards..

fields.name: `!setxp`
fields.value: Set an amount of xp someone should have. Usage: `!setxp <user> <amount>`.

fields.name: `!setlevel`
fields.value: Set an amount of level someone should have. Usage: `!setlevel <user> <amount>`.

fields.name: Set level and XP
fields.value: The set level/xp are 2 different things. The XP is the amount of XP you need before reaching a level. For example, 300 XP gets you to level 2.

fields.name: `!resetlevels`
fields.value: Reset all levels from everyone in the server.

fields.name: `!rankrole`
fields.value: Set a role reward for reaching a level. Usage: `!rankrole <level> <role(ID)>`

fields.name: `!rankroles`
fields.value: View all rank role rewards.
